pull.title: Expose information on whether transaction relay is enabled in `getnetwork`

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
net: Add fRelayTxes flag

Add a fRelayTxes to keep track of the relay transaction flag
we send to other peers.

rpc: Add `relaytxes` flag to `getnetworkinfo`

Re-work of PR #7841 by dragongem45.
Closes #7771.

issue.title: Expose information on whether transaction relayed is enabled in getnetwork
issue.body:
adding CNode::fRelayTxes to getnetworkinfo under the name of localrelay (bool)

updated pull #7839
#7771

rename.from: Expose information on whether transaction relayed is enabled in `getnetwork`
rename.to: Expose information on whether transaction relay is enabled in `getnetwork`

issue.title: Bugfix: use global ::fRelayTxes instead of CNode in version send
issue.body:
#8049 changed the calls to GetBoolArg("-blocksonly") to a global boolean `fRelayTxes`. Inside `CNode::PushVersion`, `fRelayTxes` refers to the CNode instance variable with the same name, however, causing the connecting node to always send false here, and never receive any transactions.

I've attempted to add a unit test for this, but we don't seem to ever test receiving relayed transactions by a connecting node only...

issue.title: Travis shutdown didn't result in failed job
Have scripts benefit from -blocksonly in bitcoin core
issue.body:
With this PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8049 it's possible to detect via RPC when Bitcoin Core is in blocksonly mode. This could be useful for low-resource situations.

In practice it would involve simply turning off the unconfirm transaction timeout.

We could do this by adding a new function to BlockchainInterface where it tells you whether the `unconfirmfun` callback will ever be invoked. Since future blockchain interfaces might also switch off transaction relaying.

issue.title: Backport Bitcoin PR#8049: Expose information on whether transaction relay is enabled in `getnetwork`
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#8049.

This is a simple change, it just exposes one flag to RPC.
It's needed because `fRelayTxes` variable is used in places touched by further changes.

The original PR description follows.
---
Re-work of bitcoin/bitcoin#7841 by @dragongem45.
Closes bitcoin/bitcoin#7771.

Description of issue bitcoin/bitcoin#7771 follows.
---
For software that interfaces with Bitcoin Core via RPC, it can be useful to know whether the fRelayTxes flag is set. It could be added to `getnetworkinfo`.

issue.title: Verify that expected services are available from peer nodes & disconnect otherwise.
issue.body:
Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#7749

Currently includes #2534, #4996, and #5003 this should be rebased once those merge.

Includes:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7181
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8049
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8065
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8083

Assembled from the following (commits listed in stack order):
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@ecd7fd37c8

- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@15bf863219

- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@5e7ab16d29
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@fc83f18153
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@3764dec36c

labels.name: C-upstream-port

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -460,6 +460,7 @@ UniValue getnetworkinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localrelay\": true|false,              (bool) true if transaction relay is requested from peers\n"
comments.body: What does "transaction relay is requested from peers" mean? Shouldn't this say "true if transaction relay is enabled locally"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -460,6 +460,7 @@ UniValue getnetworkinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localrelay\": true|false,              (bool) true if transaction relay is requested from peers\n"
comments.body:
Possibly - What the flag is used for is to specify in the version message whether we want to receive transactions (so whether transactions should be relayed _to us_), as well as in the network code whether we accept transactions. That we don't relay transactions is also true, but follows from that.
Maybe the naming is confusing, but I don't know a better one either.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -460,6 +460,7 @@ UniValue getnetworkinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"subversion\": \"/Satoshi:x.x.x/\",     (string) the server subversion string\n"
             "  \"protocolversion\": xxxxx,              (numeric) the protocol version\n"
             "  \"localservices\": \"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\", (string) the services we offer to the network\n"
+            "  \"localrelay\": true|false,              (bool) true if transaction relay is requested from peers\n"
comments.body: Maybe "true if we do not want to send or receive transactions"? But consider it a nit, I am not a native speaker ;)
nit: why the "e" between the "x" and "s"?
